title: Baines Wing Café
description:
Situated between the School of Healthcare and the Great Hall, Baines Wing Café has a large seating area including its own secluded courtyard which is perfect to enjoy the sunny weather.

Mixture of group seating around tables, sofas and some high level desking with 6 workstations.
1915 is based in the Sir William Henry Bragg Building on Woodhouse Lane, its relaxed and informal menu has been carefully created to offer a mix of both classic and on-trend options.

title: Hugo, the Camionnette Café
description: Hugo, the Camionnette Café, is one of the more unique members of the Great Food at Leeds team and sells a range of hot drinks, pastries and brownies.

title: Toasted in Chancellor's Court (Outdoor space)
description: Gourmet toastie van serving a range of toasties, croissants, sweet treats, cold drinks and freshly brewed coffees. Outdoor seating situated in Chancellor's Court, next to the Roger Stevens Building

imagealt: Outside the Edward Boyle Library Edit Room café
title: Outside the Edward Boyle Library Edit Room café
description: Outdoor seating situated outside the Edward Boyle Library

title: Fuse Cafe in Chemical and Process Engineering
description: Fuse at The School of Chemical and Process Engineering is a hidden gem located in the Engineering buildings. It is a quiet café with plenty of space, a perfect spot to refresh yourself.
imagealt: Fuse Cafe in Chemical and Process Engineering
Edit Room Café in Edward Boyle Library
title: Edit Room Café in Edward Boyle Library
description: Situated on the ground floor of the Edward Boyle Library, the cafe provides an eclectic mix of grab and go food and drinks for everyone to enjoy at any time of the day.

restriction: Occasional restrictions during graduations in July and December.
title: Parkinson Building - Parkinson Court South
description: Historic atmosphere with tables and chairs. Occasionally busy but mostly silent.  The study area is to the left after entering the Parkinson Building

title: Michael Sadler Building - Behind Rupert Beckett Lecture Theatre
description: Colourful study area with desks and access to clusters. Relaxed space for studying individually or with a group.
imagealt: Michael Sadler Building - Behind Rupert Beckett Lecture Theatre

title: Leeds University Union - Foyer
description: Busy study place for people that like working alongside others. Couches with big tables can be used for comfortable group working in a nice environment. Extra couches on the side for anybody wanting to read or take a break.

title: Worsley Building - Airport Lounge seating (level 7)
description: Modern colourful big area with comfortable couches and chairs. Vending, cash and cofee machines available as well as water fountain.

title: Chemistry - Chaston Chapman Lounge (room G20)
description: Bright green modern lounge located in the Chemistry Building. The perfect place to study, take a break or explore the scientific magazines that are displayed on the shelves. The couches and the chairs are very comfortable, making the area very welcoming.

title: Electronic and Electrical Engineering - Ground Floor Foyer
description: Big bright foyer with couches and circular tables with chairs. A perfect place to relax, take a break or study alone or in a group.
imagealt: Electronic and Electrical Engineering - Ground Floor Foyer

title: Mechanical Engineering - Second floor seating (room 240)
description: Comfortable small study area with couches and views from big windows.

title: Sir William Henry Bragg Building - Ground Floor Breakout Area (Room G.08)
description: Modern big break out area with café shop nearby. Social, modern and very comfortable for people to study and relax.
imagealt: Sir William Henry Bragg Building - Ground Floor Breakout Area (Room G.08)

title: Maurice Keyworth - Study Centre (Rooms 238 & 307)
description: silent study spaces with beautiful views. Outside seminar halls and occationally busy.

title: Liberty Building - Ground floor Common Area (G01)
description: Common area near the entrance of the Liberty building. Quiet space with different kinds of tables (and table football).
imagealt: Liberty Building - Ground floor Common Area (G01)

title: Esther Simpson Café
description: Located in the new Esther Simpson building on the edge of Woodhouse Moor, the café is modern and relaxed, serving speciality coffee from Darkwoods.

title: Liberty Building - First floor Group workspace (1.22)
description: Casual seating area for groups or individuals.
imagealt: Liberty Building - First floor Group workspace (1.22)

title: Charles Thackrah - Atrium (Ground Floor)
description: Modern seating area with small tables and wall-attached tables. Occasionally busy. Perfect place to take a break or prepare before class.

title: Chemical and Process Engineering - G06
description: 24 hour cluster with rows of desks. Perfect for day or night social studying with access to water fountain. 105 seat capacity

title: Chemistry and Chemistry West Block - 1.44
description: Private study space for focused study. 23 seat capacity

title: Chemistry and Chemistry West Block - 1.44A
description: 11 seat capacity.

title: Chemistry and Chemistry West Block - 1.46 (Ingold)
description: Bright large and social cluster room with variety of desks. Comfortable chairs perfect for long hours of individual or group work. 71 seat capacity.

title: Chemistry and Chemistry West Block - 140 (Cohen)
description: Large room with lines of computer desks. Silent and busy study space. 98 seat capacity.

title: Clarendon Building - G04
description: Classroom with 4 computer rows. Comfortable chairs. 50 seat capacity.

title: Clarendon Building - G07
description: Classroom with 4 computer rows. Comfortable chairs.

title: Clothworkers' Building Link - 140 (Richard Hughes)
description: Large area with no drinks or food allowed. 45 seat capacity.

title: Café Maia
description: Café Maia at Ziff is perfect for meetings, to take a break or even to do some work in the computer area.

title: Clothworkers' Building Link - G.34
description: Cluster room with a variety of desks for individual or group study. 28 seat capacity.

title: E C Stoner Building - 6.61
description: Large cluster with multiple computers and comfortable chairs. 47 seat caapcity.

title: E C Stoner Building - 6.68
description: Large cluster with multiple computers and comfortable chairs. 58 seat capacity

title: Esther Simpson Building - 109
description: Cluster room surrounded by big windows with high views of the University campus. Perfect for focused study with access to computers.

title: Fine Art, History of Art and Cultural Studies - B16 (West Teaching Labs)
description: Traditional cluster with rows of desks. Relaxed environment for 24 hours study. 33 seat capacity
imagealt: Fine Art, History of Art and Cultural Studies - B16 (West Teaching Labs)

title: Fine Art, History of Art and Cultural Studies - G29 (West Teaching Labs)
description: Inspiring cluster room surrounded by big windows with high views of the University campus. 31 seat capacity.
imagealt: Fine Art, History of Art and Cultural Studies - G29 (West Teaching Labs)

title: Irene Manton Building - 7.90
description: Rows of desks with a full left side of windows that are facing a beautiful side of campus allowing plenty of natural light into the study area. 45 seat capacity.

title: Irene Manton Building - 7.96
description: Modern large IT cluster with plenty of large windows facing a beautiful side of the University campus. 40 seat capacity.

title: Maurice Keyworth Building - 2.21
description: Large IT cluster. 70 seat capacity.

title: Costa Parkinson Court
description: Parkinson Court Café sits in one of the most iconic buildings at the University of Leeds. The café is open plan and  conveniently located for a break from working in the Brotherton Library. Serves a range of sandwiches and snacks throughout the day.

title: Parkinson Building - B.26
description: Cluster room surrounded by big windows with high views of the University campus. Perfect for focused study with acess to computers. 15 seat capacity.

title: Parkinson Building - B.32 (Woolhouse)
description: Cluster room with a variety of desks for individual or group study.

title: Psychology (37 and 41 University Road) - 1.43
description: Circular bright clusters room with pretty views on campus available 24 hours. Access to water fountain. 48 seat capacity.

title: Psychology (37 and 41 University Road) - 1.45
description: Rows of IT clusters in a theatre style. 58 seat capacity.

title: Social Sciences Building - 10.11
description: Big cluster room at the Social Sciences Building. Rows of desks with computers near a place to take a break. Perfect for studying between lectures on campus. 40 seat capacity.

title: Worsley Building - 8.038
description: Cluster room with a variety of desks for individual or group study. 52 seat capacity.

title: Worsley Building - 8.039
description: Big room that offers clusters on high and normal desks. Modern and strictly silent environment. 51 seat capacity.

title: Worsley Building - 8.049O (Fourman)
description: Large room with plenty of available clusters to use. Comfortable chairs and large desks perfect for focused study. 52 seat capacity.

title: Refectory
description: Located right at the heart of University campus, the contemporary Refectory venue offers a wide range of hot and cold food each day.

title: Worsley Building - 8.049P (Fourman)
description: Large room with computers available. 53 seat capacity.

title: Edward Boyle 11th and 12th floors
description: Silent place for studying with access to books, clusters and nice high views of the University campus. Perfect place for focused study and exam preparation.

title: Edward Boyle 10th floor
description: Busy study place for people who like working alongside others. Couches with big tables can be used for comfortable group working in a nice environment. Extra couches on the side for anybody who wants to read or take a break inside the library.

restriction: Staff or Postgraduate Library Card needed
title: Edward Boyle 13th floor
description: Silent library space for staff and postgraduate students with bookable group study rooms.

title: Edward Boyle 8th floor
description: Study space for people to attend seminars and being able to participate, study with friends and explore multiple journals. Available bookable study spaces / meeting rooms

title: Health Sciences library
description: Quiet study space within the library. Books available (related to health sciences).

imagealt: Health Sciences library - group study rooms
title: Health Sciences library - group study rooms
description: Group study rooms for group work (booking required)

imagealt: Health Sciences library - group study space
title: Health Sciences library - group study space
description: Group study space for groups inside the library.

imagealt: Laidlaw library - 3rd floor silent study area
title: Laidlaw library - 3rd floor silent study area
description: Silent study space inside the Laidlaw library.

imagealt: Laidlaw library - 2nd floor silent study area
title: Laidlaw library - 2nd floor silent study area
description: Silent study space. Group booths also available.

title: Café Seven
description: Located in the Worsley building, Café Seven is one of our most popular and vibrant cafés. Recently refurbished the large seating area is a great place to meet with friends.

imagealt: Laidlaw library - 1st floor silent study area
title: Laidlaw library - 1st floor silent study area
description: Study space inside the library, closed doors, very silent.

imagealt: Laidlaw library - 1st floor group study booths
title: Laidlaw library - 1st floor group study booths
description: Group study booths for groups of up to 5 with monitor display.

title: Laidlaw library - Footsteps fund room
description: Casual seating area.

title: Brotherton Library
description: Inspiring study place with group study areas on floor 2 of the Main Building and floor 3 of the West Building.

title: Affine Café
description: Affine is more than just a place to grab a bite. A place to break away from the pressures of the working day and enjoy a breather, a change of scenery, or even a chat with fellow professionals. Located at the heart of the innovation hub, the contemporary space provides a welcoming environment to relax and unwind. The perfect place for casual meetings or laidback lunches.

title: Loma Express Dentistry
description: Located on level six of the Worsley building, the café provides a range of grab and go food and drinks. With a focus on healthy, field-to-fork food options, LOMA Express stocks unique salad and sandwich combinations, and fresh herbal infusion teas and other delicious LOMA Express products made fresh each day.

title: Caffè Nero at Business School
description: Serving a selection of hot and cold drinks, salads, soups, sandwiches, cakes and snacks. Inside there is varied ample seating - whether you want to relax or work in groups, longer opening hours makes it the perfect spot for breaks between lectures and meetings throughout the day.

title: Caffè Nero at Laidlaw Library
description: This is the very first Caffé Nero on a University campus, specialising in high-quality Italian coffee, a warm and welcoming atmosphere, good food and great personal service.

title: Caffè Nero at Roger Stevens
description: This Caffè Nero is conveniently located at the heart of campus overlooking the sustainable pond. Serving a selection of hot and cold drinks, salads, soups, sandwiches, cakes and snacks. Inside there is varied ample seating - whether you want to relax or work in groups, longer opening hours makes it the perfect spot for breaks between lectures and meetings throughout the day.

title: Loma Café
description: LOMA is a unique offering on campus serving up specially selected craft coffee, delicious drinks and handcrafted salads and sandwiches. With a focus on healthy, field-to-fork food options, LOMA stands apart from the other food outlets on campus with unique salad and sandwich combinations you will struggle to find elsewhere.
